alert.note: Alert for North Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 1:24PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Sioux and southeastern Niobrara Counties through 100 PM MDT... At 1223 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles southwest of Provo, or 24 miles southwest of Edgemont, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Sioux and southeastern Niobrara Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
